metadata.name: your body is a battleground, 2022
metadata.description:
According to the WHO restricting access to abortions doesn't reduce the number of abortions. 

However, it affects whether they are safe and dignified. The proportion of unsafe abortions are significantly higher in countries with restrictive laws than in countries with less restrictive laws.

Data from the CDC Abortion Surveillance dataset suggests that while overall number of **reported** abortions decreased from 2010-2019, those seeking abortions out of state increased.

These trends are likely to increase should abortion access decrease, leading to undue burden for people seeking the procedure.

This piece was inspired by several things:
1) Barbara Krugar's iconic poster which was created in response to anti-abortion laws that were undermining Roe v. Wade for a pro-choice march in 1989 &
2) ode to birth control packaging design

Proceeds to PPFA
Research & references can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-zvSGiS-BAgA5oidlXB0hxYo5NvVcqWtPpnouEchK1o/edit?usp=sharing)
